doc.str: Dissolved inorganic carbon, carbon dioxide, and methane in waters from pre-labeled wet sedge plots near Toolik Lake, AK during the summer of 2000.

arr.name: attribute
arr.str: Vegetation Vegetation Vegetation Type where t= tussock, w = wet sedge
Treatment Treatment Treatment Type where c = control, f = fertilized (N+P)
Round Round Replicate Identification a = 1st replicate; b = 2nd replicate; c = 3rd replicate
Location Location Location sampled within the plot, pre label = before the 14C was applied
Category Category Type of sample, d-dic = Dissolved Inorganic Carbon sample| d-gas = Dissolved gas sample
Elev_m Elev_m Elevation of the sample site meter
Depth_m Depth_m Depth of the sample site meter
PCO2_uatm PCO2_uatm Partial Pressure of Carbon Dioxide microatmosphere
PCH4_uatm PCH4_uatm Partial Pressure of Methane microatmosphere
CO2_umol_L CO2_umol_L Concentration of Carbon Dioxide per Liter of water or gas micromolePerLiter
CH4_umol_L CH4_umol_L Concentration of Methane per Liter of water or gas micromolePerLiter
DIC_umol_L DIC_umol_L Concentration of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon micromolePerLiter

arr.name: attributeDescription
arr.str: Vegetation Type where t= tussock, w = wet sedge
Treatment Type where c = control, f = fertilized (N+P)
Replicate Identification a = 1st replicate; b = 2nd replicate; c = 3rd replicate
Location sampled within the plot, pre label = before the 14C was applied
Type of sample, d-dic = Dissolved Inorganic Carbon sample| d-gas = Dissolved gas sample
Concentration of Carbon Dioxide per Liter of water or gas
Concentration of Methane per Liter of water or gas

doc.str: Arctic Long-Term Ecological Research (ARC LTER) Program

arr.name: site
arr.str: Arctic LTER Experimental Plots: Wet Sedge Tundra Block 2 Northeast corner near Toolik Field Station, North Slope, Alaska.
Arctic LTER Experimental Plots: Moist Acidic Tussock Tundra (MAT) Northeast corner block 1 near Toolik Field Station, North Slope, Alaska.

doc.str: Pre-labeled dissolved inorganic carbon, carbon dioxide, and methane from experiemental plots near Toolik Lake, AK from 2000
